description: ## Sections  * Page 1 Samsung Galaxy Note 7  * Page 2 [Performance, S Pen and Software]()Just like the Galaxy S7, the Note 7 has an ‘Always-on display’. Even when thephone is locked, a clock and a row of notification icons glow on the screen.The bonus with AMOLED tech is that it only needs to light up individualpixels, so there’s not a huge drain on battery from this feature. My biggestissue with the original way the AOD worked has been resolved, as it’ll nowdisplay icons from every app rather than just Samsung’s own.It’s a nice, if unessential, feature that can be both annoying and useful. Butat least you can turn it off.[ Next  Performance, S Pen and Software](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-note-7-performance-s-pen-and-software-page-2)
